reviews.review_msg: Great prof. This was my second time taking 220 and it was so much better. I felt like I actually learned something this time and the lectures were much more straight forward. Both Vienna and Payten (TA) were fast to respond in emails and they are both very nice! I wished more teachers were as nice!
She's overrated.
A lot of assignments that take 5-8 hours to complete that are only worth 5% of your grade which u had to complete and hand in to pass.
If I knew that participation was worth 15% i probably would have gone to more tutorials but that is my bad. I liked this version of 220 more than j wong's
I don't like group projects but this was the one time where it was okay because we got to make our own groups. Great prof and hope she teaches more classes
Would take a course with Vienna again.
An angel. Take her class

i LOVE going to Viennas class. I am at sfu 8am-7pm and my last lecture is with her, i ALWAYS look forward to it. no matter how tired i am. I absolutely love her and wish i could take every one of her classes

Vienna is the most caring professor I have had at SFU. I had never taken a forensics class before, but she made sure the content was accessible and always encouraged questions. It's clear that she truly cares about her students' success and wellbeing. If you want a high grade in her class, she will support you in getting one.

Vienna is very nice and I admire her passion and dedication to the content and students. That being said, the assignment criteria was not very clear and resulted in some pretty poor marks (you have to read between the lines). The content is very scientific/medical which can be pretty difficult. Overall it was a good class, not my favorite though.

I really enjoyed taking this class with Vienna in Fall 2022, especially with how the materials were delivered. It was interesting how that term's avg was a B+ seeing how the norm is usually a B-/B. Lectures are straightforward, however, I believe that the first assignment could use a bit more instruction as it was a bit vague. Highly recommend!

The final was a take home group project. My friends that took the course last time said it was a take home that they had to do individually so it seems like it can change semester to semester. The class was interesting and the infographic assignment was fun. No papers and big exams.
Vienna really cared about students during the pandemic and makes super interesting lectures. She brings a ton of guest lectures and is open to emails and questions a ton!

Dr. Lam was very supportive during this pandemic. I hope more professors cared about our mental health and well-being. The class itself is interesting but the readings were boring. I wished the lectures were longer so there would be less of a focus on the readings for the quizzes.

Vienna was very nice and seemed to care about her student's success. She gave two opportunities fro bonus marks which was awesome. She had a lot of guest lecture which is cool if your are interested in under water investigations. Only negative was that her assignment criteria was pretty hard to understand and a lot of students had questions.

218 was one of my favourite classes at SFU so far! The topics were really different each week so it felt kind of random, but it made me super interested in forensics and now I'm doing the forensics certificate. I hope she teaches more classes! She's very nice and the exams were pretty easy.

This course is HARD! I really appreciated how she would explain stuff in office hours. Her emails were very short but she went and explained things from the text practically every office hour. This class is supposed to be for non bio students but there's definitely an expectation that you know some bio first. If you can, try to get her as a TA!

Best prof at sfu. She tests a lot from her lectures and the posted slides don't have all the info delivered in class. Tutorials were okay. Exams were directly from slides but the guest lecture questions were tricky.

My special topics course ended up being taught by Professor Vienna Lam on the subject of taphonomy. And let me tell you, that was the BEST class I have ever taken, I wish I could take it again! Her lecutres were interesting, easy to follow, and she was super helpful both in and out of class. I highly recommend taking it if you have the chance!

I often wonder if teachers actually read the surveys they make us take or if they just do them to make us feel heard. I literally asked for the 3hr final exam on a weekday to be changed to a 3-day take home (during a weekend)... AND SHE DID IT! I think teachers had some options because of COVID but I didn't think she would make it open book & 3day!

Vienna is the first Prof to ever reach out when I was struggling. There are 100+ students in the class yet she noticed when I didn't submit an assignment. Without judgement, she contacted me individually to see if I was okay. Vienna isn't just a good teacher. She's also a good person.

This is a really easy distance class. There are recorded lectures, and open book (timed) quizzes each week that are super easy. Definitely read first before attemtping them though, because the quizzes are timed. Overall good class and Vienna was easy to message and very understanding. Couldn't have asked for a better prof during the pandemic!

Was really helpful over email. Tough online class with lots of components though. Even though it's online, you have a lot to do and the weekly quizzes are timed! The content is pretty easy, just a lot of memorizing. I probably should have taken the lecture version.

Vienna is one of the best profs I've ever had. Her lectures are informative, interesting, and definitely to the point. She is really caring and respectful of her students, and if you attend every one of her lectures you'll receive a good grade without a doubt.
She's respond really fast. The exam was very hard but met with me to really help with the paper.
Midterm didn't go well, but vienna was nice enough to meet and go over the exam and on another day, explained the confusing parts of readings. Fast to respond.
interesting class but lots of readings. vienna is fast to respond to emails and rescheduled midterm BEFORE the school was closed due to snow. A+ for caring about safety of students!

Took the distance version. There are a lot of readings!!! Interesting content but you have to read a lot to prepare for exams. Vienna was pretty helpful and answered a lot of emails so you're not completely in the dark like most dist classes

Took this in spring. Even though the tutorials are not marked, ATTEND! Vienna gave a lot of exam advice and does a great job of explaining the material. Exams were marked really hard but the tutorials were fun.

By far the most knowledgeable and friendly TA I have had in my 5 years of undergrad. I've had her as my TA for both Crim 355 & 356, and I can tell you she makes every effort possible to help her students. Her numerous awards are a testament of just how fantastic she is at what she does. Vienna is a real gem, and SFU is extremely lucky to have her.

Vienna is a stellar teaching assistant; she makes every effort possible to help her students and her warm personality is very comforting when you find yourself lost in the material. Further to this, her tutorials are informative and she does a great job of engaging the class without singling anybody out.
